column4: Is it safe to shrink my ubuntu partition then expand the ntfs by the amount I shrunk ubuntu???? gparted
you cant expan a partition to the left
can I change the position of the partion??
If you shrink a partition, you cant really do anything with the freed space other than turn it to a new partition....
No :/ its pretty annoying...
I messed up a dual boot now windows does not have enough room what to do??
You dont have enough room? how's your drive divvied up exactly?
26gig for win the balance of a 60gig for linux and swap
26 gigs isnt enough? Do you need to remove something from it?
My daughters machine she has a huge amount of data and games
Maybe I need to reinstall and but the ubuntu on correctly this time
Well in this case id say you just need to clear some room on it so it'll boot. You can access windows partitions in linux.
Well you could reinstall ubuntu on a partition further to the right and then expand the windows one, yes
OK that sounds like a plan
But it's probably going to be just as easy to temporarily clean it up until you can add some space...
Just remember, partitions can only grow to the right, not left.
I have a 30gig usb drive I can throw some stuff on
I will remember
okie dokie
No prob, i know all this very well :P I cant tell you how long it took me to figure out fricking partitions
xD
